document.topic_text: Seattle church vandalized with racist messages Ted Land reports. Ted Land, KING 5:36 A Seattle church was vandalized with racist messages. Photo by Ted Land / KING. (Photo: KING) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST Seattle Police are investigating after a church was vandalized and burglarized overnight. Someone spray-painted "Go back 2 Africa" on a wall inside Curry Temple C.M.E. Church on 23 rd Ave. and marked hallways with at least three large swastikas. A wall in the back of the church has a large "n" word spray-painted on it. Nearby storage rooms have been ransacked, with dishes and other church supplies broken and scattered on the floor. Church leaders believe a check book and debit card were stolen. Church members, visibly shaken by the slurs and damage, gathered Sunday morning to pray and comfort each other. "This was about hurting and maybe terrorizing, but we’re not scared," said Rev. Beverly Jackson. She explained to the congregation that it's ok to weep, and to be angry, but their mission will not be disrupted by some writing on the wall. "God sees the best in us," Jackson said. At least three large swastikas were spray painted on church walls. Photo by Ted Land / KING. (Photo: KING)
